attributes.action: Reduce unnecessary plastic to save turtles
attributes.additional_details: In a new study published in the journal Scientific Reports, scientists examined data about the deaths of 1,000 sea turtles that washed up on the shores of Australia, looking at the amount of plastic debris found inside their stomachs, intestines and rectums. According to a press release, researchers at Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) in Australia found that a turtle had a 22 percent chance of dying from ingesting one plastic item. Once a turtle gobbles 14 pieces of plastic, the mortality rate jumps to 50 percent. Once an animal eats 200 pieces of plastic death is eminent

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you would like to reduce plastic waste, but are not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might also like to sign this petition: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/230906
